name: Kachina Lodge

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked the Kachina Lodge because El Tovar was full and we had heard that you "must" stay on the rim. They were right. It is true the lodge is mired in the 50's in decor and amenities, but the view (we paid for a rim view room)is great. We also woke up to two elk outside our window engaging in a little "rack" wrestling. I went out to take pictures and found these wild animals thoroughly ingore you. (I don't know what happens during the rut season!) Got pictures of an elk by the flagpole that had a rack bigger than the width of my outstretched arms. He was obviously accustomed to tourists and cameras, and some hardy souls got to within 8 feet of him as he strolled casually down the rim path. The Canyon itself is awesome, but the experience of the wildlife was a wonderful extra. I think they come in to graze on the irrigated lawns which must be like dessert to them after eating scrub grass and brush all day. By sunrise they had all disappeared into the neighboring forest.
reviews.title: Wonderful Experience

reviews.text: Stayed at Kachina Lodge 9th and 10th September. It was the most expensive hotel of our trip and the room was the oldest and basic of the whole trip. However you are paying for location and views. We booked a room with partial view a year ago and we ended up in a room with an unobstructed view which was lucky. There is no balcony (disappointing- why don't they build something with balconies) but you can open the windows wide and lean out. We could sit up in bed and watch the sun rise on the canyon. Parking we lucked out and got a parking spot just outside. the car stayed there for the two days. At night Elk come and eat on the lawns which was nice.
reviews.title: on the old side, expensive but you are paying for convenience and an awesome view

reviews.text: Overall I though it was fine.
reviews.title: Plain room but 30 yrd from canyon
Too expensive and parking is scarce
reviews.text: Eating - ate at the El Tovar the first night having booked a month in advance. Didn't get a view so not sure what the point is. Only about four tables have a view. Food was good but expensive. Anyway a one night treat.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Ate at the Angel lodge on the second night and for breakfast . It was fine nothing special. Service depended on the waiter, most were good, except one who I would have fired if I was the manager.
reviews.title: Definitely Stay in the Park

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spent a couple of days at the South Rim. The accomodations at Kachina Lodge were better than expected but nothing great. We arrived early and were able to get parking in front of the hotel (as guests were checking out) and get a canyon view room on the second floor. The room was basic and the beds were ok. Our room had a safe, coffee set up and TV. Curious, the TV offered about 7 or 8 channels with two dedicated to religious programming and a couple broadcasting infomercials. Not that you would come here to watch TV (or change your religion or buy something).
reviews.title: Better than Expected

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The canyon is, well, GRAND. Unfortunately, the din of traffic is constant Hords of people seem to be between you and where you want to be. It's difficult to appreciate the grandeur the canyon has to offer. However, as long as you focus on what is ahead, you will enjoy. Area reminded me of Graceland with a gift shop in every building. There is so much history in this region and it takes a back seat to selling trinkets and post cards. You are required to take a shuttle bus to the west end of the park. We waited an hour to get on the bus and another to return. Not very organized with loading and unloading done slowly. I realize public transportation is necessary, it can be done in an efficient manner. We were also surprised by the lack of park rangers throughout the park. With the Grand Canyon NP being one of the top 5, you would expect more.
reviews.title: "So- so View But That's About It"

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had dinner at the El Tovar dining room. It was OK but we felt rushed and the food came out warm. I suppose they need to turn tables. Not the fine dining experience I expected. The El Tovar Hotel was interesting. We found out after that they offer hotel tours. It isn't publicized but available to those who ask.
reviews.title: Right on the Canyon rim. A great place to stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent time here and at the North Rim and between the two, the North Rim wins hands down. It is quiet and intimate. The drive from the South Rim takes 5 hours but you do pass the nicest part of the Painted Desert as well as the red rocks of the Vermillion Cliffs.
reviews.title: Wonderful Place - a definite gem

reviews.text: I still recommend coming to the South Rim as the Grand Canyon is one of the wonders of the world and no amount of complaining from an old fart like me can take it away.
reviews.title: best place on south rim to stay

reviews.text: We (2ad, 2 ch) had in Kachina Lodge a one night stay during our california trip. We had a 2Queen room (2 floor) with partial view but the view is FULL. The El Tovar has no such good view.
reviews.title: Wow - What a view

reviews.text: We had also visited Bryce Canyon which I found it better than Grand Canyon, but too cold during April (~1 degree of Celsius).
reviews.title: poor accommodation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: small, utility built ,warm, with no insulation between rooms, you can hear everything.
reviews.title: Save yourself headaches and money stay someplace else

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The main restaurant in the EL Tovar was very good, A comprehensive wine list and good quality cooking, not fine dining. Very good service.
reviews.title: Worth every penny for the view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I followed all of the advice fellow travelers had posted here. I booked well in advance. Got there early and found a parking spot near the Hopi gift shop about 1/4 mile from my hotel. I requested a second floor room with a view at the Kachina. What I got was a 1st floor, end off the hall, next to the exit door room with an obstructed view (tree and light post). When I called to request a room change I was told that if I wanted to give up my superior accommodations (king size, non-smoking room), they would be happy to find me a second floor, no view, with a double bed.
reviews.title: Not the best room to be stuck in a snow storm

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed 1 night at the Kachina Lodge. I was expecting it to be quite basic from the reviews on site and indeed it was. Quite old fashioned in style with very basic furniture and furnishings and basic bathroom. However everything was functional and clean and the view more than made up for everything. Whatever you do don't stay off the Grand Canyon National Park however much you want luxurious accommodation which this clearly isn't. You really want to be there so you can see the sun go down and come up and experience the whole thing. To have stayed just outside the National Park would have been a real let down. It's just a shame that the accommodation isn't better, particularly as it isn't cheap! The best would be to stay in the El Torvar hotel which is clearly a more luxrious option but this seems to get booked up very quickly so I would advise booking as soon as possible. I tried about 6 weeks before we went and it was fully booked. The thing that saved our room was being in the National Park and the fact that we had a view out over the Canyon! Can anything be better?? We were able to get up at 4.30am to see the sunrise and there were lots of deer playing outside our room on the grass which was fantastic to see. We ate in the El Torvar hotel in the evening and it is barely 5 minutes walk away which was handy. There was plenty of parking although it is a bit of a walk from the carpark to the room with suitcases but service was efficient and all in all I was pleasantly surprised at how good the whole experience was. I couldn't tell when booking exactly how basic the places were going to be and the exact location so all in all it was a very good experience.
reviews.title: Fantastic View and Location saves the relatively basic accommodation

reviews.text: Getting to the hotel is half the fun - we came from the East Rim and stopped all the way along. First stop after the sight seeing, El Tovar Lodge to check in. This is one of the reasons that Kachina Lodge is cheaper (no restaurants either). Then around to settle into our rooms. Unfortunately, there isn't a lot of parking near the hotel, so we had to wait 15-20mins for someone to leave (but the bus system is so good in the park that you shouldn't need to move again).
reviews.title: Sunrise over the Grand Canyon - not the only reason to stay here.
Older Motel with a fantastic view
reviews.text: After lugging 3 of our 4 suitcases up the stairs, one of the cleaning staff that had been watching us mentioned the elevator (useful for our departure) but there were still a handful of stairs to navigate to get to the 2nd floor (it's split level).
The rooms are fairly simple (#6333 had two beds, a small fridge and a clean bathroom) but most people aren't there for the hotel room!
reviews.title: Beautiful View

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Whilst El Tovar has a beautiful dining room, it is "haute cuisine" (their term, not mine). We found the restaurant at Bright Angel Lodge was perfect for all meals, and only a short walk from Kachina.
reviews.title: Basic dormitory type accommodation

aka: Kachina Hotel Grand Canyon National Park
